page.title: 14LAUNCHING THE LIFEBOAT
page.content: LAUNCHING THE CAISTER-ON-SEA LIFEBOAT The first man opens the doors to the Lifeboatstation, the engineers arrive and start the tractor's engines. The first 8 men, including the coxwain, are crew. The tractor driver reverses out of the station,pushing the boat before him. The cox waits until the tractor's tracks are awash. This signifies that the boat is capable of floating. The cox blows a whistle & simultaneous operations occur. The driver disengages from the trailer & drives up the beach. The 4 crew positioned around the boat knock the pins holding the boat onto the trailer clear, and the 'fall groups' continue pulling until the boat leaves the trailer. The cox nows sees the boat can travel under its own power, and thus the lifeboat is launched.
